intro: Jamesbrittenia giessii, commonly known as the Giessii rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal and pinnately divided, while its flowers are usually bright yellow or white. The species is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to colonize disturbed or rocky habitats.
